result.execSummary:
The defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kerry Snow Whitehead Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kerry Snow Whitehead Jr was found guilty of Soliciting a Child for Prostitution, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.08.
  • Kerry Snow Whitehead Jr was found guilty of Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, fees and assessments. Any cash bail to apply.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended supervision.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all approriate costs.
the court advised defendant as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant to register as a sex offender for 15 years after sentence is completed.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment and/or vocational training.
Cooperate with any mental health, counseling treatment programs as recommended by agent.
No contact with AR dob 7/23/1997 and SC dob 8/21/1997.

Any vehicle owned must be reported to agent.
Pay supervision fees as determined by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
AODA assessment.  Follow through with recommended programming.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions as stated on count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerry Snow Whitehead Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment signed and filed. 
The Court orders: denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. spc
Count 4.
Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment on count four returned because he has not served the applicable percentage of confinement on this count.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Avia R. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26199606 in court 1x. on 7/14/14.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Savannah C. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26199605 in court 1x. on 7/14/14.
re: sentencing, received and filed.

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Michael B. Plaisted.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  Additional by Demetrius L. and Arneda W.
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 6 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 2 YEARS with credit for 136 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 4 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 2 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 1 YEAR with credit for 0 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 1 YEAR on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
CONDITION OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Defendant prohibited from engaging in any social media sites.
- If defendant obtains internet service, must make computer available to agent for inspection upon demand.
- Cooperate with any mental health, counseling treatment programs as recommended by agent.
- Any vehicle owned must be reported to agent.
- Seek and maintain employment and/or vocational training.
- No contact with AR (dob: 7/23/1997) and SC (dob:  8/21/1997).
- Court ordered defendant to register as a Sex Offender for 15 years after sentence is completed.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed; copy to defendant.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 7/15/14 for Avia R. and Savannah C. c/o Jason H. for 1 appearance each on 7/14/14.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 & 3 dismissed.

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT1 as amended and COUNT 4-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Michael B. Plaisted.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for jury trial. Discussion regarding Dr. Collins' report dated 7/07/14. State and defense do not challenge the report. Court accepts the opinion of Dr. Collins and finds the defendant competent to proceed. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED- Soliciting a Child for Prostitution, contrary to sec. 948.08, 939.50(3)(d) Wis Stats., a Class D Felony.

COUNTS 2, 3 & 4 remain the same. Copy of amended information given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Doctor's Report received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court will not vacate the jury trial date at this time due to the speedy trial demand entered. Due to the short time period before the jury trial date, Dr. Collins will interview the defendant this afternoon and provide an expedited report. Clerk will inform the parties when the report is completed. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/14/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. Parties inform the court there are no pending motions or pretrial issues to discuss. Discussion regarding prior convictions of witnesses. Defendant informs the court he does not understand what the parties are discussing during this proceeding. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court denied defendant's request for a new attorney. Defendant placed on the record two witness names he wishes his attorney to call at trial. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7/14/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead not in court, in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in trial posture when attorneys appeared.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-03-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Defense counsel has not filed any motions. Discussion regarding pending discovery issues. Defense counsel does not believe the missing discovery will effect his ability to be ready for the jury trial date. Parties request adjourned final pretrial date to have time to address the pending discovery. Court grants adjournment. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 07/14/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State. Defense counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense and State to file any motions by 05/08/2014. Jury instructions, witness lists, and motions in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Defense counsel will be submitting a written bail motion. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Michael B. Plaisted.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Josh Mathy for Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Dawn Jones-MPD Detective. Exhibits 1-3 are marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 25.   Exhibits are ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SC (DOB:  08/21/1997) and AR (DOB:  07/23/1997).

Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in court with attorney Mark A. Dluzak.  Defendant Kerry Snow Whitehead in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
